example.para: This example demonstrates how to set custom template for the suggestion items depending on the length of their string representation.
First, create a custom class that inherits the class and override its method.
Then define instance of this class in the static resources. It is easier to set the template styles in XAML.
Now you can define the and set its ItemTemplateSelector property:

member.name: M:Telerik.UI.Xaml.Controls.Input.RadCalendar.MoveToLowerView(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Moves the calendar to the lower view level if possible (e.g. from Year view to Month view) updating the property in the process. The action is performed with default animation.
member.param: The date to move to on the lower view level.

member.name: P:Telerik.UI.Xaml.Controls.Input.RadCalendar.PointerOverCellStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the that defines the appearance settings applied to calendar cells when the pointer is over them.

example.code: <telerikInput:RadCalendar> <telerikInput:RadCalendar.PointerOverCellStyle> <telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle> <telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.ContentStyle> <Style TargetType="TextBlock"> <Setter Property="Margin" Value="7,0,4,4"/> <Setter Property="FontSize" Value="18" /> <Setter Property="FontWeight" Value="Bold" /> <Setter Property="Foreground" Value="RoyalBlue" /> <Setter Property="TextAlignment" Value="Center" /> <Setter Property="VerticalAlignment" Value="Center" /> </Style> </telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.ContentStyle> <telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.DecorationStyle> <Style TargetType="Border"> <Setter Property="Background" Value="PaleGreen" /> <Setter Property="BorderBrush" Value="SkyBlue"/> </Style> </telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.DecorationStyle> </telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle> </telerikInput:RadCalendar.PointerOverCellStyle> </telerikInput:RadCalendar>

member.remarks: If you want to customize the appearance only of some special calendar cells that fulfill this criteria, you should inherit from the class and assign the custom instance to the property.

member.name: P:Telerik.UI.Xaml.Controls.Input.RadCalendar.NormalCellStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the that defines the appearance settings applied to all regular calendar cells that belong to the current view.
member.remarks: If you want to customize the appearance only of some special calendar cells that fulfill this criteria, you should inherit from the class and assign the custom instance to the property.

example.code: <telerikInput:RadCalendar> <telerikInput:RadCalendar.NormalCellStyle> <telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle> <telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.ContentStyle> <Style TargetType="TextBlock"> <Setter Property="Margin" Value="7,0,4,4"/> <Setter Property="FontSize" Value="18" /> <Setter Property="FontWeight" Value="Bold" /> <Setter Property="Foreground" Value="RoyalBlue" /> <Setter Property="TextAlignment" Value="Center" /> <Setter Property="VerticalAlignment" Value="Center" /> </Style> </telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.ContentStyle> <telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.DecorationStyle> <Style TargetType="Border"> <Setter Property="Background" Value="PaleGreen" /> <Setter Property="BorderBrush" Value="SkyBlue"/> </Style> </telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.DecorationStyle> </telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle> </telerikInput:RadCalendar.NormalCellStyle> </telerikInput:RadCalendar>

member.name: P:Telerik.UI.Xaml.Controls.Input.RadCalendar.AnotherViewCellStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the that defines the appearance settings applied to all calendar cells that belong to another view.
member.remarks: If you want to customize the appearance only of some special calendar cells that fulfill this criteria, you should inherit from the class and assign the custom instance to the property.

example.code: <telerikInput:RadCalendar> <telerikInput:RadCalendar.AnotherViewCellStyle> <telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle> <telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.ContentStyle> <Style TargetType="TextBlock"> <Setter Property="Margin" Value="7,0,4,4"/> <Setter Property="FontSize" Value="18" /> <Setter Property="FontWeight" Value="Bold" /> <Setter Property="Foreground" Value="RoyalBlue" /> <Setter Property="TextAlignment" Value="Center" /> <Setter Property="VerticalAlignment" Value="Center" /> </Style> </telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.ContentStyle> <telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.DecorationStyle> <Style TargetType="Border"> <Setter Property="Background" Value="PaleGreen" /> <Setter Property="BorderBrush" Value="SkyBlue"/> </Style> </telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.DecorationStyle> </telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle> </telerikInput:RadCalendar.AnotherViewCellStyle> </telerikInput:RadCalendar>

member.name: P:Telerik.UI.Xaml.Controls.Input.RadCalendar.BlackoutCellStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the that defines the appearance settings applied to all calendar cells that are disabled.
member.remarks: If you want to customize the appearance only of some special calendar cells that fulfill this criteria, you should inherit from the class and assign the custom instance to the property.

example.code: <telerikInput:RadCalendar> <telerikInput:RadCalendar.BlackoutCellStyle > <telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle> <telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.ContentStyle> <Style TargetType="TextBlock"> <Setter Property="Margin" Value="7,0,4,4"/> <Setter Property="FontSize" Value="18" /> <Setter Property="FontWeight" Value="Bold" /> <Setter Property="Foreground" Value="Gray" /> <Setter Property="TextAlignment" Value="Center" /> <Setter Property="VerticalAlignment" Value="Center" /> </Style> </telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.ContentStyle> <telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.DecorationStyle> <Style TargetType="Border"> <Setter Property="Background" Value="#DDDDDD" /> <Setter Property="BorderBrush" Value="SkyBlue"/> </Style> </telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.DecorationStyle> </telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle> </telerikInput:RadCalendar.BlackoutCellStyle> </telerikInput:RadCalendar>

member.name: P:Telerik.UI.Xaml.Controls.Input.RadCalendar.SelectedCellStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the that defines the appearance settings applied to all calendar cells that belong to the current view and are selected.
member.remarks: If you want to customize the appearance only of some special calendar cells that fulfill this criteria, you should inherit from the class and assign the custom instance to the property.

example.code: <telerikInput:RadCalendar> <telerikInput:RadCalendar.SelectedCellStyle> <telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle> <telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.ContentStyle> <Style TargetType="TextBlock"> <Setter Property="Margin" Value="7,0,4,4"/> <Setter Property="FontSize" Value="18" /> <Setter Property="FontWeight" Value="Bold" /> <Setter Property="Foreground" Value="RoyalBlue" /> <Setter Property="TextAlignment" Value="Center" /> <Setter Property="VerticalAlignment" Value="Center" /> </Style> </telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.ContentStyle> <telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.DecorationStyle> <Style TargetType="Border"> <Setter Property="Background" Value="PaleGreen" /> <Setter Property="BorderBrush" Value="SkyBlue"/> </Style> </telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.DecorationStyle> </telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle> </telerikInput:RadCalendar.SelectedCellStyle> </telerikInput:RadCalendar>

member.name: P:Telerik.UI.Xaml.Controls.Input.RadCalendar.HighlightedCellStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the that defines the appearance settings applied to all calendar cells that belong to the current view and are highlighted.
member.remarks: If you want to customize the appearance only of some special calendar cells that fulfill this criteria, you should inherit from the class and assign the custom instance to the property.

example.code: <telerikInput:RadCalendar> <telerikInput:RadCalendar.HighlightedCellStyle> <telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle> <telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.ContentStyle> <Style TargetType="TextBlock"> <Setter Property="Margin" Value="7,0,4,4"/> <Setter Property="FontSize" Value="18" /> <Setter Property="FontWeight" Value="Bold" /> <Setter Property="Foreground" Value="RoyalBlue" /> <Setter Property="TextAlignment" Value="Center" /> <Setter Property="VerticalAlignment" Value="Center" /> </Style> </telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.ContentStyle> <telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.DecorationStyle> <Style TargetType="Border"> <Setter Property="Background" Value="PaleGreen" /> <Setter Property="BorderBrush" Value="SkyBlue"/> </Style> </telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.DecorationStyle> </telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle> </telerikInput:RadCalendar.HighlightedCellStyle> </telerikInput:RadCalendar>

member.name: P:Telerik.UI.Xaml.Controls.Input.RadCalendar.CurrentCellStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the that defines the appearance settings applied to the currently focused cell in the calendar view.
member.remarks: If you want to customize the appearance only of some special calendar cells that fulfill this criteria, you should inherit from the class and assign the custom instance to the property.

example.code: <telerikInput:RadCalendar> <telerikInput:RadCalendar.CurrentCellStyle> <telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle> <telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.ContentStyle> <Style TargetType="TextBlock"> <Setter Property="Margin" Value="7,0,4,4"/> <Setter Property="FontSize" Value="18" /> <Setter Property="FontWeight" Value="Bold" /> <Setter Property="Foreground" Value="RoyalBlue" /> <Setter Property="TextAlignment" Value="Center" /> <Setter Property="VerticalAlignment" Value="Center" /> </Style> </telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.ContentStyle> <telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.DecorationStyle> <Style TargetType="Border"> <Setter Property="Background" Value="PaleGreen" /> <Setter Property="BorderBrush" Value="SkyBlue"/> </Style> </telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.DecorationStyle> </telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle> </telerikInput:RadCalendar.CurrentCellStyle> </telerikInput:RadCalendar>

member.name: P:Telerik.UI.Xaml.Controls.Input.RadCalendar.DayNameCellStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the that defines the appearance settings applied to all column header cells that represent the day names when this calendar instance is in mode.

example.code: <telerikInput:RadCalendar> <telerikInput:RadCalendar.DayNameCellStyle> <telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle> <telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.ContentStyle> <Style TargetType="TextBlock"> <Setter Property="Margin" Value="7,0,4,4"/> <Setter Property="FontSize" Value="15" /> <Setter Property="Foreground" Value="RoyalBlue" /> <Setter Property="TextAlignment" Value="Center" /> <Setter Property="VerticalAlignment" Value="Center" /> </Style> </telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.ContentStyle> <telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.DecorationStyle> <Style TargetType="Border"> <Setter Property="Background" Value="PaleGreen" /> <Setter Property="BorderBrush" Value="SkyBlue"/> </Style> </telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle.DecorationStyle> </telerikInput:CalendarCellStyle> </telerikInput:RadCalendar.DayNameCellStyle> </telerikInput:RadCalendar>

example.para: Finally, use the CustomStyleSelector class in the RadCalendar control:

member.remarks: This will only change the appearance of the cells, to change their state, you have to set the property.

member.name: P:Telerik.UI.Xaml.Controls.Input.RadRangeSlider.TopLeftScaleStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the that defines the appearance settings applied to the top/left Scale control.
member.remarks: The style should target the type.

example.code: <telerikInput:RadRangeSlider> <telerikInput:RadRangeSlider.TopLeftScaleStyle> <Style TargetType="telerikPrimitives:ScalePrimitive"> <Setter Property="LabelPlacement" Value="None"/> <Setter Property="TickPlacement" Value="BottomRight"/> <Setter Property="TickTemplate"> <Setter.Value> <DataTemplate> <Ellipse Width="5" Height="5" Margin="-2.5,0,0,10" Fill="LimeGreen"/> </DataTemplate> </Setter.Value> </Setter> </Style> </telerikInput:RadRangeSlider.TopLeftScaleStyle> </telerikInput:RadRangeSlider>

member.name: P:Telerik.UI.Xaml.Controls.Input.RadRangeSlider.BottomRightScaleStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the that defines the appearance settings applied to the bottom/right Scale control.
member.remarks: The style should target the type.

example.code: <telerikInput:RadRangeSlider> <telerikInput:RadRangeSlider.BottomRightScaleStyle> <Style TargetType="telerikPrimitives:ScalePrimitive"> <Setter Property="LabelPlacement" Value="BottomRight"/> <Setter Property="TickPlacement" Value="TopLeft"/> <Setter Property="TickTemplate"> <Setter.Value> <DataTemplate> <Ellipse Width="5" Height="5" Margin="-2.5,10,0,0" Fill="LimeGreen"/> </DataTemplate> </Setter.Value> </Setter> </Style> </telerikInput:RadRangeSlider.BottomRightScaleStyle> </telerikInput:RadRangeSlider>
